definition: to sink down to/to be reduced to (sth inferior)
to sink (into ruin, oblivion)/to be reduced to
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)

sentences.english: In 1814, Malta became a part of the British Empire.
sentences.chinese: 1814年，马耳他岛沦为大英帝国的殖民地。

sentences.english: Children mostly became orphans from being born out of wedlock or women dying in childbirth.
sentences.chinese: 通常非婚生或是母亲难产而死的孩子都沦为了孤儿。

sentences.english: From this it was but a step to beggary .
sentences.chinese: 这只差一步就沦为乞丐了。

sentences.english: The federal stimulus package falls into the same category.
sentences.chinese: 联邦政府的经济刺激方案与上述政策沦为了一丘之貉。

sentences.english: Many people have stayed behind in the potential war zone .
sentences.chinese: 许多人留在了可能会沦为交战区的地方。

sentences.english: After the Opium War of 1840 -1842, China slowly became semi - colonial and semi - feudal society country.
sentences.chinese: 鸦片战争后，中国逐渐沦为半殖民地半封建国家。

sentences.english: Abandoning or spoiling the justice will make the law become evil law or bad law.
sentences.chinese: 在法中摒弃或作贱正义，便会使法沦为恶法或劣法。

sentences.english: I know, I was just the worry, eventually fell unfounded worry.
sentences.chinese: 我知道，我的担心，最终只是被沦为了自作多情。

sentences.english: In friends' heart, I've been marginalized as a cocky man unworthy of care. "Unaccountable"!
sentences.chinese: 在朋友的心目中，你早已沦为不值得计较的妄人。

sentences.english: We are not all equally likely to fall prey.
sentences.chinese: 我们沦为牺牲品的可能性不尽相同。

sentences.english: He was beggared by spending so much on drinking.
sentences.chinese: 他没节制地花钱买酒，因而沦为乞丐。

sentences.english: Many will be unable to pay off the loan and risk becoming "zombie debtors".
sentences.chinese: 许多人将无法付清贷款，有可能会沦为僵尸负债人。
朝鲜于1910年沦为日本的殖民地。

sentences.english: Being single can make you a slave to the idea of finding someone.
sentences.chinese: 单身，会让你沦为“找个伴儿吧”的奴隶。

sentences.english: The group has not appeared the Chinese soccer degenerates into the object which the media denounces in word and in writing.
sentences.chinese: 小组都没出现的中国足球沦为媒体口诛笔伐的对象。

sentences.english: In friends’ heart, I’ve been marginalized as a cocky man unworthy of care.
sentences.chinese: 在朋友的心目中，你早已沦为不值得计较的妄人。

definition: to degenerate/impoverished/to fall (into poverty)/to be reduced (to begging)

to become/to turn into
sacrificial victim/sb who is expendable/item sold at a loss
to change into/to turn into/to become
to abandon/to discard/to renounce/to dump (sb)
a matter for ridicule/an object of ridicule/laughingstock
to lose/to forfeit
to lose
to change shape in a single shake/fig. to take on a new lease of life
to suffer (defeat, death etc)
one stumble, unable to rise (idiom); a setback leading to total collapse/ruined at a stroke/unable to recover after a minor hitch
to decline/to wane
tantamount to/to be like
to downgrade/to lower the standard/degrading/humiliating
